abstract: Strong ratings for the new whodunit crime show â€œThe Mentalistâ€ helped CBS eke out a slight victory on Tuesday as the most watched network despite day two of ABCâ€™s ratings juggernaut â€œDancing With the Stars.â€ According to Nielsenâ€™s estimates, the new 9 p.m. drama, with Australian actor Simon Baker in the lead role, attracted 15.5 million viewers, nearly 5 million better than CBS’s premiere of “The Unit” in the same time period a year ago. “The Mentalist” made its debut in a plum time slot wedged between CBSâ€™s â€œNCISâ€ at 8 p.m., which garnered its largest premiere audience in its six seasons (17.7 million), and â€œWithout a Traceâ€ at 10 p.m. (11.4 million). Among adults 18 to 49, however, CBS ranked third behind second place ABC with its two-hour block of â€œDancing With the Starsâ€ from 9 to 11 p.m. (18.2 million) and Fox, which led the night in that age group despite lagging in third in total viewers. Fox broadcast â€œHouseâ€ at 8 p.m. (12.1 million) and â€œFringeâ€ at 9 p.m. (9.7 million). ABC would have won the night outright had it not trailed badly during the 8 p.m. hour with the debut of its new family game show â€œOpportunity Knocksâ€ (6.6 million). NBC finished fourth, drawing 7.2 million for â€œThe Biggest Loserâ€ from 8 to 10 p.m. followed by â€œLaw & Order: Special Victims Unitâ€ in the 10 p.m. time slot (9.5 million). NBC nearly tied CBS for third place in the 18-to-49 set. Finally, the CW, in fifth place as usual, earned 3 million viewers for “90210” at 8 p.m. but just 1.9 million for “Privileged” at 9 p.m.

lead_paragraph: Strong ratings for the new whodunit crime show “The Mentalist” helped CBS eke out a slight victory on Tuesday as the most-watched network despite Day 2 of ABC’s ratings juggernaut “Dancing With the Stars.” According to Nielsen’s estimates, the new 9 p.m. drama, with the Australian actor Simon Baker in the lead role, attracted 15.5 million viewers, nearly 5 million better than CBS’s premiere of “The Unit” in the same time period a year ago.

headline.main: Ratings: ‘The Mentalist’ Lifts CBS, but Then a Real Mentalist Would Already Know That
